H0.text: A 'triskelion', a symbol consisting of three bent human legs is featured on the flag of which British crown dependency. Jersey

H1.text: A 'triskelion', a symbol consisting of three bent human legs is featured on the flag of which British crown dependency. Guernsey

H2.text: A 'triskelion', a symbol consisting of three bent human legs is featured on the flag of which British crown dependency. Alderney

H3.text: A 'triskelion', a symbol consisting of three bent human legs is featured on the flag of which British crown dependency. Mannin

A4.text: The symbol appears in the island's official flag and official coat of arms

A5.text: The flag of the Isle of Man was officially adopted between 1928 and 1932

A6.text: The Manx coat of arms dates back to the 13th century
